tool.name: Noisy
tool.command:
noisy $input_align #if $sequence_type.seqtype == 'cfg' : ## Automatic sequence detection ## read an info file to choose which option set #set $info = open( str($input_info) ).read() #if 'dna' in $info: --seqtype D #else if 'protein' in $info : --seqtype P #else --seqtype R #end if #else : --seqtype $sequence_type.seqtype #end if --cutoff $cutoff --distance $distance #if $input_matrixfile : --matrix $input_matrixfile #end if #if $missingchar.setmissingchar == "true": --missing $missingchar.chars #end if --ordering #if $orderingmethod.ordering == "rand": RAND[,$orderingmethod.randpermut] #else if $orderingmethod.ordering == "list": $orderingmethod.randpermutlist #else: $orderingmethod.ordering #end if $constant $gap --shuffles $shuffles --smooth $smooth --silent;
sed 's/^>\s*/>/' *_out.fas > output.fas;

param.name: input_info
param.label: Information file
param.help: Precompute file containning sequence description (dna or protein)

param.name: cutoff
param.label: cut-off [ 0-1 ]
param.help: Columns with a score below the cut-off are removed from the output alignment.

param.name: gap
param.label: Count gap symbol as character state?

param.name: smooth
param.label: Running average over X columns
param.help: Calculate a running average over the reliability score of X columns and use this smoothed values to remove unreliable columns from the MSA

param.name: shuffles
param.label: Perform INT random shuffles per column of the MSA

tool.help:
Usage::
noisy [OPTIONS] MultiFastaAlignment
Options::
--cutoff FLOAT Set cutoff value to FLOAT. Columns with a score below FLOAT are removed from the output alignment. (default is >0.80<) --distance STRING Distance method used by Neighbor-Net. (default is >HAMMING< [HAMMING|GTR]) -h, --help Print usage message for noisy. --matrix FILE Use distance matrix for Neighbor-Net from FILE. (default is >calculate distances with nnet<) --missing STRING Set list of missing characters to STRING. (default is >N<) --nogap Don't count gap symbol as character state. (default is >0<) --noconstant Ignore constant columns in output alignment. (default is >0<) --ordering STRING Choose ordering method. (default is >nnet<) nnet Neighbor-Net qnet QNet algorithm is O(n^4) both in time and memory, be careful when you use this option. rand[,INT] sample INT random permutation. With rand a random sample of all possible orderings of the TAXA can be specified for which the reliability score is calculated (default is >1000<) INT,INT,... provide ordering explicitly as comma-seperated list of TAXA indices in the range (e.g 3,0,4,1,2 as ordering for the 5 TAXA in the input MSA). all all permutations, If all is used than for all possible permutations of the TAXA the reliability score is calculated (Note that for more than 8 TAXA this can become rather time consuming!).
--shuffles INT Perform INT random shuffles per column. (default is >1000<) -s, --silent Turn off status bar (default is >0<) --smooth INT Running avarage over INT columns. (default is >1<) --seqtype CHAR Set sequence type of input alignment to CHAR (default is >D<) [D=DNA, P=Protein, R=RNA] -v, --verbose Verbose mode. Causes noisy to print debugging messages about its progress.
